Post-Match Reflections: Goga Bitadze's recent performances have highlighted his adaptability, showcasing a player capable of stepping up when needed and filling critical gaps for the team.
Franz Wagner commends Goga Bitadze's readiness and defensive amid Wendell Carter Jr.'s absence
Magic head coach Jamahl Mosley also praised Bitadze's defensive impact, noting the center's ability to anchor the team with his rim protection and facilitate offense through smart play.
Jamahl Mosley highlights Bitadze's versatility in Magic's win over Pelicans
This whole situation is gonna help us down the road – everybody gets an opportunity and gets playing time and that's what you need on a long season

His ability to protect the rim defensively, I think is a big key, his pick and roll coverages. He does a great job of communicating,And then offensively, you can play through him at times. We talked about how much we are cutting and moving off the basketball and I think he did a great job of facilitating a lot of that – the guys trust him there because they know he has a high basketball IQ and he knows exactly what we're trying to accomplish.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Goga Bitadze stepped into a starting role after Wendell Carter Jr.'s injury, marking a shift in his playing time and responsibilities.
Goga Bitadze recorded 11 points, nine rebounds (five of which were offensive), three assists, two blocks, and a steal, shooting an efficient 5-for-6 from the field.
The Magic snapped a five-game losing streak on Friday night with a decisive 115-88 victory over the New Orleans Pelicans.
Over the last three games, Bitadze has averaged 10.7 points, 10.0 rebounds, three assists, two blocks, and one steal per game, shooting an impressive 62.5% from the field.
Wendell Carter Jr. remains sidelined indefinitely due to an injury sustained against the Dallas Mavericks.
The Magic, now looking to build momentum after their recent win, will continue their five-game homestand with a matchup against the Washington Wizards on Sunday night at 6:00 p.m. ET.
